STATIC_heading.text: ABBREVIATIONS

STATIC_table.text:
AIDSacquired immunodeﬁciency syndromeIEC Immunoeffector cells–cells activated to defend the body in an immune response. 
CAR T-cells chimeric antigen receptors; activated in laboratory to ﬁght cancer cells IgA, IgD, IgE, IgG, IgM immunoglobulins
CD4+ cellhelper T cellIL1 to IL38 interleukins
CD8+ cellcytotoxic T cellKS Kaposi sarcoma 
CMV cytomegalovirus—causes opportunistic AIDS-related infection KSHV Kaposi sarcoma herpesvirus; herpesvirus 8 
Crypto Cryptococcus —causes opportunistic AIDS-related infection MAIMycobacterium avium-intracellulare (MAI) complex—group of pathogens that cause lung and systemic disease in immunocompromised patients
ELISA enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay— test to detect anti-HIV antibodiesMoAb monoclonal antibody 
G-CSF granulocyte colony-stimulating factor— cytokine that promotes neutrophil production NHL non-Hodgkin lymphoma 
GM-CSF granulocyte-macrophage colonystimulating factor—cytokine secreted by macrophages to promote growth of myeloid progenitor cells and their differentiation to granulocytes PCPPneumocystis pneumonia— opportunistic AIDS-related infection
HAART highly active antiretroviral therapy—use of combinations of drugs that are effective against AIDS PI protease inhibitor
Histo histoplasmosis—fungal infection seen in AIDS patients RTI reverse transcriptase inhibitor—for example, zidovudine (Retrovir) or lamivudine (Epivir) 
HIV human immunodeﬁ ciency virus—causes AIDSSCID severe combined immunodeﬁciency disease 
HSV herpes simplex virusTreg regulatory T cell (suppressor T cell)
Toxo toxoplasmosis—parasitic infection associated with AIDS
